results.title: Kitchen management principles
results.creator_credit: Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Joseph Cote
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cooking, home economics”.
Presents five concepts dealing with kitchen management - the kitchen, planning for efficiency, cleanliness and safety, setting the table and washing up. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Kitchen come true
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ernest Reid, Betty Brunke and Alvin Armstrong
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how an old fashioned farm kitchen may be updated into a modern and convenient 1945 kitchen through careful planning and efficient conversion of existing space and materials. During the planning stage, the following are considered: saving steps in the kitchen; provision of adequate shelf space; facilitating house cleaning; provision of ample laundry space; washing and cleaning area; and a well-lit desk for children’s homework. Shows the planning, design, construction and enjoyment of a new kitchen.

results.title: Kitchen and Canteen Safety
results.brief_description: Few other work areas match the kitchen in number and variation of risks and hazards. Hygiene, personal protective equipment, manual handling, use of knives, slips, trips and falls, dealing with kitchen fires and general hazards are all addressed and appropriate action suggested in this program.

results.title: Kitchen = Wo ai chu fang
results.creator_credit: Pineast Pictures, Harvest Crown, Yim Ho and Akira Morishige
results.brief_description: Banana Yoshimoto’s popular Japanese novel ‘Kitchen’ is radically reworked in this film of the same name by director Yim-Ho. ‘Kitchen’ is a slowly paced but affectionate study on grief and the emotional state and journey of the bereaved. When Aggie’s grandmother (Yasuko Tomita), her last living relative, dies, she is taken in by hairdresser acquaintance Louie (Jordan Chan), and Emma (Law Kar Ying) his transsexual ‘mother’. With warmth and affection the two slowly arouse Aggie from her listless state and nurture her back to life. ‘Kitchen’ uses food as a constant metaphor throughout the film to explore emotional states and to symbolise the depth of unexplored feelings. When tragedy strikes again with sickly premonition, both Louie and Aggie are forced to revisit their grief, triggering unresolved issues. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Kita: or, What have you done for me lately?
results.creator_credit: BNA Films, Richard L. Wormser and William C. Jersey
results.brief_description: Frederick Herzberg points out that improvements in hygiene, wages, working conditions, and fringe benefits do not have a lasting effect on job motivation, and that the work people do is more important than how they are treated.

results.title: Kissin' cousins
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sam Katzman and Gene Nelson
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays a dual role in this film - Airforce Lieutenant Josh Morgan, and a countrified Jody Tatum. Morgan is sent by the Government on the unenviable job of trying to secure hillbilly land for a proposed missile base. Much to Morgan’s surprise he is faced with a blonde, country version of himself which means double the songs and women. Cast also includes Arthur O’Connell, Glenda Farrell, Jack Albertson and Pam Austin. Includes the following songs; “Kissin cousins”, “Barefoot ballad” and “Tender feeling”.

results.title: Kiss or kill [DVD]
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Australian Asset Management, South Australian Film Corporation, Movievision, Bill Bennett Productions, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Bennett
results.brief_description: Nikki (Frances O’Connor) and Al (Matt Day) are lovers and small time scammers. When a routine job leaves a man dead in a hotel room, they decide to head west across the barren Nullarbor Plain carrying a video showing football hero Zipper Doyle (Barry Langrishe), in an intimate moment. With the cops (Chris Haywood and Andrew S. Gilbert) on their tail, they stay overnight at a motel. Next morning the motel owner (Max Cullen) is dead; murdered. Fleeing further into the desert, the two suspects are given shelter by an eccentric couple at their isolated shack. By morning, they too are murdered. Nikki and Al begin to suspect each other of the multiple killings and start learning things about each other they wished they never knew. Meanwhile, with the assistance of an Aboriginal tracker, the cops are closing in.

results.title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
results.creator_credit: HB Filmes, Sugarloaf, David Weisman and Hector Babenco
results.brief_description: Set in a Latin American prison during a military dictatorship, this film explores the relationship that develops between two cellmates: a left wing journalist (Raul Julia) and a homosexual window dresser (William Hurt). To entertain his cellmate during the monotony and horror of prison life, the latter recreates stories from his favourite 1940’s movies. Based on the novel by Manuel Puig, the film features William Hurt’s Oscar winning performance.

results.title: Kiss Me Petruchio (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is a funny, fast-paced documentary based on the New York Shakespeare Festival’s production of “The Taming of the Shrew”. starring Meryl Streep and Raul Julia. This film goes behind the scenes to find out what makes the 400-year-old play relevant to audiences today. The show features interviews intercut with sections of the play.
